Subsubseries III: General Subcommittee on Education

This subseries consists of 1.5 linear feet of material dating from 1967-1984. The majority of files contain information about H.R. 69, a bill introduced in 1974 to amend and extend the Elementary and Secondary Education Act (ESEA) of 1965. Major issues in the act included revision of the Title I formula for distribution of federal funds to states, criteria for distribution of Title I funds (testing vs. poverty levels), the consolidation of education programs, and impact aid laws. Information about these amendments can be found under the specific issue name (e.g. Title I, Consolidation, Testing). Additional information appears in the various briefing and floor binders. The Committee Markup binder contains overview information about all issues regarding the amendments; memoranda addressing the Administration's input on the amendments and political implications for major sections of the bill; and drafts of amendments. "ESEA: Floor -- Amendments Binder" contains summaries of proposed amendments organized by the sponsor (e.g. Brademas, O'Hara, Peyser, Carey, etc.) The "ESEA: Floor Book" addresses the Title I formula, including Brademas' formula based on the Orshansky Index as well as alternatives. "ESEA: Floor – General Debate" materials also focus on Title I and include committee votes, overview information of H.R. 69, and proposed questions and answers for Brademas regarding Title I. Correspondence folders contain letters from constituents, lobbying groups, and various institutes and organizations voicing their opinion on the amendments.

A small amount of material does not deal with the 1974 amendments, including the ESEA Amendments of 1967 (H.R. 7819). Two folders provide summaries of meetings of the subcommitee with outside experts: "Child Development – Bronfenbrenner, Urie" and "Meeting Summary" (with Dr. Robert Dentler and Dr. David Fox).
